word: "THE AMERICAN COSTUME," HERE REFERRED TO BY MRS. WHITE, WAS A MODIFICATION OF THE EARLIER STYLE AND WAS SPONSORED BY DR. HARRIET AUSTIN OF DANSVILLE, NEW YORK. IT COMBINED THE SHORT SKIRT, "REACHING ABOUT HALFWAY FROM THE HIP TO THE KNEE," WITH MANNISH-LOOKING TROUSERS, COAT, AND VEST. SEE DESCRIPTION ON PAGE 465. THIS "SO-CALLED REFORM DRESS" WAS IN 1864 SHOWN TO MRS. WHITE TO BE UNSUITABLE FOR ADOPTION BY GOD'S PEOPLE.
